titleStmt.title: Thomas M. Freeman et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8969

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his exellency the governor of Ky Jas F. Robinson.

Your petitioner James M. Harkin says at the July term of the Anderson Circuit Court held in 1863 he was fined the sum of thirty dollars, for obstructing a public high way. The petitioner was ignorant of the fact that it was a county road but established by. And the undersigned Jury who tried the case, state that they are well acquainted with the petitioner J M. Harkin and know him a clever good citizen and who would not knowingly injure any community. They therefor ask said fine to be remited

Jury
Tho. M. Freeman
John Y. Perry
Samuel Burge
Sanford Gordan
William Lacefield
Jackson Sievs
P, A, Spears
L. McClain
Francis M, Miller
J J Carter
Jury
Travis Brown
James McCall

Anderson Cr. Ct
J. M. Harkins Petition
$30. } Mis.
Fine remitted
J F Robinson
Issd Aug. 8. 1863
